intro: Kohautia subverticillata, commonly known as the spiral kohautia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves around the stem. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Kohautia subverticillata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important species in New Zealand's native flora.
